summary: Glucose is a type of sugar with the formula C6H12O6. It's the most common monosaccharide, a kind of carbohydrate. Plants make glucose during photosynthesis, using sunlight, water, and carbon dioxide. All living things use glucose to make ATP, their energy source. Glucose is stored as a polymer (like amylose, amylopectin, or glycogen) and circulates in our blood as sugar. It's so important that it's on the World Health Organization's list of essential medicines. The name "glucose" comes from the Greek word for "sweet."
title: Glucose
